title: BASF works to achieve net zero carbon emissions by 2050 - CosmeticsDesign.com USA
summary: BASF is committing to carbon management as a core part of its sustainability strategy in ingredient manufacturing, focusing on reducing carbon footprints within the cosmetics and personal care industries. They are implementing practices to address Scope 3 emissions and have developed a digital tool to calculate Product Carbon Footprints for their extensive product range. Despite challenges in the complex supply chain and material availability, BASF aims for net zero CO2 emissions by 2050 through new technologies and continuous improvement processes. Their efforts could influence other chemical producers to adopt similar sustainability measures.
green_innovation: TRUE, because BASF is implementing carbon management strategies and innovative technologies to minimize environmental impacts and enhance sustainability in their production processes.
business_innovation: TRUE, because BASF is introducing a new digital application tool and updating its supply chain practices significantly different from previous methods to improve sustainability in its operations.
green_product: FALSE, as the article does not specifically mention a distinct good designed to be environmentally friendly, but rather refers to processes and strategies.
green_process: TRUE, as BASF's carbon management strategies and the development of a digital tool for calculating product carbon footprints demonstrate efforts to minimize environmental impact and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 3251 - Basic Chemical Manufacturing, 3254 - Pharmaceutical and Medicine Manufacturing, 3253 - Pesticide, Fertilizer, and Other Agricultural Chemical Manufacturing, 3332 - Industrial Machinery Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, as the article does not exhibit misleading claims about environmental benefits. Instead, it details genuine efforts by BASF to implement carbon management and improve sustainability.

title: Where Is Oregon's Seafood? â€“ Oregon Business - Oregon Business
summary: The Oregon Coast Visitors Association (OCVA) is working to keep local seafood in Oregon by developing infrastructure to support small-scale processing, storage, and distribution of seafood. They aim to increase access to local seafood, reduce economic leakage, and enhance community nutrition and food security. OCVA is also promoting innovation in seafood products and raising awareness about the importance of consuming local seafood. Their efforts aim to foster local partnerships and sustainable practices in the seafood industry.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the initiatives described aim to reduce economic leakage, enhance food security, and promote sustainable practices in the local seafood industry, all contributing to environmental sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article discusses OCVA's new and improved business processes and partnerships aimed at selling local seafood and developing distribution channels, which differ significantly from the previous methods.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not explicitly identify a specific green product but rather discusses the overall initiative to improve local seafood availability.
green_process: TRUE, as the efforts involve creating new processing, storage, and distribution methods that minimize environmental impacts and utilize local resources effectively.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 3117 - Seafood Product Preparation and Packaging, 4244 - Grocery and Related Product Merchant Wholesalers, 5416 - Management, Scientific, and Technical Consulting Services, 3121 - Beverage Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not indicate any misleading statements or practices from OCVA regarding the environmental benefits of their initiatives; rather, it emphasizes genuine efforts to improve local food systems and sustainability.
